_header: Trouble hearts to set in quiet
Note:
Formerly 3808 when incorrectly alphabetized after ‘true’; for translation from Calot, see Floran (1909)
XFloran, Mary. “Document relatif à l’entrée du roi d’Angleterre Henry VI à Paris en 1431.” Revue des études historiques 75 (1909): 411-15, 411.
Title(s): ‘On the English title of Henry VI to the Crown of France’
Subjects: translations; Henry VI; France, crown of; historical poems
_description: John Lydgate, ‘On the English title of Henry VI to the Crown of France’, translated from the French of Laurence Calot — 329 lines in couplets

BLHar7333.First Lines:
TRouble hertis to sette in quyeteAnd make folkys their language for
                    to lette
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
God him graunt oonly of his graceOf mercy þere for to haue a
                    place
BLHar7333.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth A remembraunce of a peee dengre / How that the kyng of
                    Englond Henry the sext / is truly borne heir vnto the Corone of ffraunce / by
                    lynyall Successioun als wele on his ffader / side Henry the fifthe whom god
                    assoil as by / Kateryne quene of Englond his modir whom god assoile made by
                    lydygate John the monke / of Bury at Parys by þe instaunce of my lord / of
                    Warrewyk (f. 31rb, rubric); Here endith þe genologie of kyng
                    henry þe Sext… (f. 32vb, rubric)
